did.unittitle: William Woodville Rockhill papers,

physdesc.extent: 34 boxes, 6 card file boxes, and 8 volumes (18 linear ft.)

did.abstract: Papers of American scholar-diplomat William Woodville Rockhill.

acqinfo.p: *46M-386 and *46M-386A-T. Gift of Courtland Hoppin, Esq., 131 East 94th St., New York, N.Y.; received: 1947.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on physical access to this material.

userestrict.p: Images linked to the finding aid describing this collection are intended for public access and educational use. This material is owned and/or held by the Houghton Library, and is provided solely for the purpose of teaching or individual research. Any other use, including commercial reuse, mounting on other systems, or other forms of redistribution requires the permission of the curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation for Publication:
prefercite.p: William Woodville Rockhill Papers (MS Am 2121). Houghton Library, Harvard University.

bioghist.p: Rockhill was an American scholar-diplomat known especially as the first Westerner to befriend and advise a Dalai Lama of Tibet. He was U.S. Minister to Greece, Romania, Serbia, China, Russia, and Turkey.

arrangement.p:
Organized into the following series:
I. Correspondence and other papers
II. Unidentified material
III. Miscellanea
IV. Diaries, account book, and commonplace book
V. Letterbooks
VI. Card index to these papers

scopecontent.p: Chiefly letters to William Woodville Rockhill from various correspondents including: Henry Adams, Horace Newton Allen, Samuel Beal, Henri Cordier, Chandra Das Sarat, William Foster, Alfred Edward Hippisley, Friedrich Hirth, Sir John Scott Keltie, Richard Olney, Theodore Roosevelt, Reinhold Rost, Thomas Watters, James Harrison Wilson, and John Russell Young. Also contains speeches and articles by William Woodville Rockhill and his diaries from 1908 to 1914. There is correspondence of Thomas C. Rockhill and a commonplace book about him. Finally, there are letterbooks with copies of typed letters to various people and an account book belonging to Edward Augustus Rockhill, among other materials.
